attributes.action: wish Rupert Murdoch the best of luck in charging for internet content and becoming unGoogleable
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Rupert Murdoch has announced that, within the next 12 months, all News International outlets online will become subscription-only, with online content hidden behind paywalls. Furthermore, content will become unsearchable on Google, whom Murdoch accuses of stealing content by displaying search results.

Murdoch also wants the courts to overturn 'fair use' doctrine, and he wouldn't mind an end to Net Neutrality either. 

Rupert Murdoch is forging a brave and lonely new path on the internet. After being so...unlucky...with Sportal and MySpace, we think Rupert deserves a bit of luck. The PM has a good track record on wishing people good luck, so let's hope he really digs deep for an old friend who sold him down the river...

rejection.details: Your petition should make a point about government policy. Wishing someone 'good luck' does not relate to government policy.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
